t: Psalm 50
God the Righteous Judge
A Psalm of Asaph.
The*pn Mighty One, God the Lord,*s Has*ld spoken and called the earth From*ld the rising of the sun to its going down.
Out*ld of Zion, the perfection of beauty, God*ld will shine forth.
Our*ld God shall come, and shall not keep silent; A*ld fire shall devour before Him, And*ld it shall be very tempestuous all around Him.
He*ln shall call to the heavens from above, And*ld to the earth, that He may judge His people:
“Gather*ld My saints together to Me, Those*ld who have made a covenant with Me by sacrifice.”
Let*ld the heavens declare His righteousness, For*ld God Himself is*i Judge. Selah*ipg
“Hear,*pn O My people, and I will speak, O*ld Israel, and I will testify against you; I*ld am*i God, your God!
I*ld will not rebuke you for your sacrifices Or*ld your burnt offerings, Which*ild are*i continually before Me.
I*ld will not take a bull from your house, Nor*ild goats out of your folds.
For*ld every beast of the forest is*i Mine, And*ild the cattle on a thousand hills.
I*ld know all the birds of the mountains, And*ld the wild beasts of the field are*i Mine.
“If*ln I were hungry, I would not tell you; For*ld the world is*i Mine, and all its fullness.
Will*ld I eat the flesh of bulls, Or*ld drink the blood of goats?
Offer*ld to God thanksgiving, And*ld pay your vows to the Most High.
Call*ld upon Me in the day of trouble; I*ld will deliver you, and you shall glorify Me.”
But*ln to the wicked God says: “What*ld right*i have you to declare My statutes, Or*ld take My covenant in your mouth,
Seeing*ld you hate instruction And*ld cast My words behind you?
When*ld you saw a thief, you consented with him, And*ld have been a partaker with adulterers.
You*ld give your mouth to evil, And*ld your tongue frames deceit.
You*ld sit and*i speak against your brother; You*ld slander your own mother’s son.
These*ld things*i you have done, and I kept silent; You*ld thought that I was altogether like you; But*ild I will rebuke you, And*ld set them*i in order before your eyes.
“Now*ln consider this, you who forget God, Lest*ld I tear you*i in pieces, And*ld there*i be*i none to deliver:
Whoever*ld offers praise glorifies Me; And*ld to him who orders his*i conduct aright*i I*ld will show the salvation of God.”
